conversion_verification.notes: The 3D render clearly shows visible wall height, thickness, and a perceptible interior volume from an angled view with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls have height and thickness (5), floors are separated (3), interior volume is perceivable (4), 3D corner geometry is good (3). Angled view (5), interior visible from elevated perspective (3), minimal perspective distortion (2). Roof cleanly removed (5), interior fully visible (3), clean geometry (2).

geometric_accuracy.notes: Most room configurations are correct, with minor discrepancies. Adjacency is mostly preserved. Major wall positions align well. Doors are present, but windows are only partially and inaccurately represented, especially on the 'alcove' and 'breakfast' area walls.

interior_elements.notes: Some major furniture (bathroom fixtures, kitchen counters/sink) are present. Placement is logical, but detail is very basic. Not all expected elements are replicated, e.g., the 'alcove' area has no defined use.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear and readable (4). Interior is clearly visible and lighting does not obscure it (6). Consistent material usage (2), no major rendering artifacts (2), clean background (2). No text labels.

detected_errors.description: Windows are either missing or not accurately placed/sized according to the 2D plan, especially prominent on the exterior wall of the 'alcove' and the 'breakfast' area.

The area next to the Kitchen specified as 'Breakfast' in the 2D plan seems to be an open space in 3D, and the specific wall layout for the 'alcove' and the 'central hall' leading to 'WC' have some minor discrepancies in partitioning and door placement.
Interior elements are very basic and sparse. The 'alcove' area, 'dining room', and 'central hall' are devoid of any furniture, which is expected to be inferred even if simplified.
Some internal subdivisions are simplified, such as the utility room's internal layout not being fully represented.

summary: The 3D transformation is generally good, demonstrating excellent fundamental conversion and visual clarity, but it suffers from some geometric inaccuracies in wall placement and significant omissions/inaccuracies in windows and interior elements when compared to the 2D plan.
